name: bouchee
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a small, light, pastry case filled with sweet or savoury (= seasoned or flavoured but not sweet) food: The word "bouchée" means "mouthful", and is from the French "bouche", the mouth. The remaining puff pastry can be cut into various shapes and used to make bouchees.
More examplesFewer examplesA bouchée is a small puff pastry case with filling -- a mouthful to serve as an appetizer or a sweet bite after a meal.Prepare the puff pastry bouchées in advance and cook them shortly before they are needed.
